coming soon!

Support small businesses.

Help the struggling local economy.

Practice social distancing by shopping small and local, not big and crowded.

The COVID-19 pandemic has been devastating for many small businesses in Washington, which are the cornerstone of our local economy. They often operate on razor-thin margins, and business owners don’t always have a safety net. With the streets becoming a ghost town, and many restaurants having sit-down dining banned, paying customers are hard to come by for any type of small business. But people are flocking in droves to larger stores, increasing their chances of spreading the virus. Why not spread out more by shopping small?

Learn more about social distancing:
See Washington Post Article

That’s where WA.business comes in. We want to help. For free.

We have created a hub where local businesses can promote themselves. For free. Potential customers will browse a variety of photos, a charming description, and important information such as delivery options. For free. Don’t have a website? A lot of small businesses don’t. We’ll create a page for you, with anything a customer might need, and encourage people to use the hashtag #WAbusiness to share your page on social media. For free.

Why are we doing all of this for free? Because we want to help other businesses, and we know how.

Create a space for your business here on WA.business.

Want us to feature your business on this website for free? Simply fill out this Google Form and you will soon see your small business on this site.
